answers.a: A regular arrangement of atoms in a crystal
answers.b: A cell of atoms in a lattice
answers.c: The smallest possible element of a lattice that is repeated in all directions

explanations.c: This is the correct definition of an unit cell

questions.question: Which of these are true about an unit cell?

answers.a: A repetitive arrangement of them can build the whole crystal
answers.b: An unit cell cannot be divided into smaller pieces that serve as unit cells themselves

explanations.c: These facts come from the definition of an unit cell

questions.question: How many atoms are shared by a cubic primitive unit cell with its neighbours?

explanations.c: A cubic primitive unit cell shares 8 atoms with its neighbours

questions.question: What is the contribution of an atom on the vertice of an unit cell to the unit cell?

explanations.b: A vertice atom contributes 1/8 to the unit cell.

questions.question: What is the contribution of an atom in the middle of a face of an unit cell to the unit cell?

explanations.d: An atom on the face of a unit cell can only be shared by one more unit cell. Hence its contribution is 1/2

questions.question: Which of these are primitive unit cells?

explanations.c: Simple cubic unit cell has one atom. So does a Wigner-Seitz unit cell
